summary: The "timetable for EMU" refers to the structured schedule established by the European Union for the implementation of the Economic and Monetary Union (EMU). This regulatory framework outlines the phases leading to the adoption of the euro as the common currency, ensuring convergence criteria are met by member states. The timetable is crucial for maintaining monetary stability and facilitating economic integration within the EU. It serves as a legal benchmark for assessing progress towards full monetary union, thereby reinforcing the overarching objectives of the EU's monetary policy and fostering economic cohesion among member states.
